long_desc.thetext:
This is not very important in the general case, but quite important for us as we have to implement our app in any host web page.
The zIndex for blockers in Qooxdoo (10000) is sometimes not enough for some elements.
Would it be possible to change it to a higher value (25000 or even 100000) in qx.ui.root.Page and qx.bom.Blocker?
This is a bug that can be done in 5 minutes.
Hey, why don't you just set the z-index yourself? That should not be a problem with those two classes you mentioned? Best, Martin
Hmm, what do you mean "set the zIndex" myself?

I guess you have already identified the widgets having the wrong z-index, right? If you have the blocker object e.g. just set the z-index with setBlockerZIndex. For the page, it should just be the z-index of the applications root widget.
I am not sure I have the blocker object. Anyway this improvement is for better "out-of-the-box" behavior.
If there is a way to change the values, I don't see a reason to change anything in the framework so please try to get it done with the public API.

Martin, we should be careful with changing the zIndex for qx.ui.core.Blocker otherwise we get some troubler with qx.ui.window.Manager. The qx.ui.root.Page uses the qx.ui.core.Blocker as blocker implementation and this blocker is used for modal windows. When we use a higher zIndex value as a window zIndex than the window can't be accessed.
